tools.title: Visual Studio Code
tools.description: Visual Studio Code is a go to text editor for all your coding needs.

tools.title: GitHub
tools.description: GitHub is a web-based hosting service for version control using Git. It is mostly used for open source projects.

tools.title: Brave
tools.description: Brave is a chromium web browser with built-in privacy settings. Blocks ads and trackers!

tools.title: Daily Dev
tools.description: Daily Dev is a blog that covers the latest web development news.

tools.title: Vim
tools.description: Vim is a highly configurable text editor. It is used for all kinds of text editing, including programming. (Yes, I know how to exit vim ðŸ˜Ž. Cool right?)

tools.title: Figma
tools.description: Figma is a free, open-source tool for designing and prototyping interactive interfaces. It is used for designing and prototyping web and mobile apps.

tools.title: Notion
tools.description: Notion is a free, open-source, web-based note-taking app. It is used for taking notes and planning.

tools.title: Discord
tools.description: Discord is the easiest way to talk over voice, video, and text. Talk, chat, hang out, and stay close with your friends and communities

extensions.title: Auto Close
extensions.description: Automatically add HTML/XML close tag, same as Visual Studio IDE or Sublime Text

extensions.title: Bracket Pair Colorizer
extensions.description: A customizable extension for colorizing matching brackets

extensions.title: ES7+ React/Redux/React-Native snippets
extensions.description: Extensions for React, React-Native and Redux in JS/TS with ES7+ syntax. Customizable. Built-in integration with prettier.

extensions.title: Remote - WSL
extensions.description: Open any folder in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) and take advantage of Visual Studio Code's full feature set.
